title: Can we make a house on agriculture land? - Quora

response.answer_text: In most cases… Yes.But you need to check some things out to see if its practical. Is it in a flood plain? If yes, don’t build there.Is the soil stable enough to support the house?How far will the power company need to run the wire? You have to pay for that and the cost of the poles or the digging if its underground.How about water access? You do not want to have to pay for water to be trucked in.Can it pass a perk test for septic or is there sewer service available? You do not want to have to have a holding tank pumped every month. And more…

Technically yes. But if you have other options then I'd suggest proceeding with those. In the US you might have to deal with zoning laws, which requires you to appeal the land’s classification before the county. Not only that, you might be buying prime land. This is land used to grow crops and make money, therefore it's inherently more expensive than non-agricultural land. You might be better off buying pasture land instead.

Yes, you can. If you want to make farm house ( without concrete slab) you can build it. if you want to make concrete slab houses then you have to convert agriculture land to non agriculture land in revenue department and then make any type of house.
